Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a detailed picture of a habitat that includes both land and water features.
The student can accurately depict a variety of plants and animals within the chosen habitat (e.g., trees, shrubs, deer, birds in a forest).
The student can show different habitats like a forest and a pond, including characteristic living things for each (e.g., fish and frogs in a pond, trees and squirrels in a forest).
The student can illustrate patterns by accurately showing how specific plants and animals belong in particular habitats (e.g., cacti in deserts, not forests).
CANNOT: The student may not consistently show the diversity of living things across different habitats (e.g., limited examples in one habitat compared to another).
The student might occasionally miss including smaller, less noticeable organisms like insects or smaller plants (e.g., grass or moss) *(student tends to focus on larger, more obvious creatures)*.
